title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: NIH research grant funding rates plummeted in 2025
items.description: Agency acknowledges young investigators are losing out as result of multiyear funding policy imposed by White House

items.title: Trump’s NSF pick is a stranger to its research community
items.description: Jim O’Neill will need to build ties, say former agency leaders

items.title: New energy department science advisory committee reflects Trump’s AI push
items.description: DOE’s 21-member Office of Science Advisory Committee is well-qualified but lacks disciplinary breadth, observers say

items.title: ChatGPT spits out surprising insight in particle physics
items.description: Physicists combined human acumen and AI-assisted math to show that a doubted particle interaction is possible after all

items.title: A shocking explanation for tape’s distinctive screech
items.description: Fast-moving cracks in tape’s adhesive layer produce shock waves that make the stuff sing as it unrolls

items.title: Journal giant Elsevier unveiled an AI tool that scans millions of paywalled papers. Is it worth it?
items.description: First-of-its-kind product raises questions about costs, access, and equity

items.title: A little-known flu virus is sickening cattle around the world. Are humans next?
items.description: Features of recently identified influenza D point to possible pandemic threat

items.title: Unorthodox ‘universal vaccine’ offers broad protection in mice
items.description: Immune-stimulating cocktail could shield against diverse bacterial and viral infections

items.title: Pollution plume from falling rocket debris tracked in real time
items.description: New analysis sheds light on space junk’s small, growing effects on upper atmosphere

items.title: Scientists decry Trump’s rush to loosen radiation exposure standards
items.description: White House push to boost nuclear power could lead to more cancer cases, some researchers say
